hudson.tasks.Shell.command:
set -e cd ~jenkins/
cat > buster/root/run-thunderbird.sh <<GLOBALEOF set -v if test ! -d /root/thunderbird-coverity; then hg clone https://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/ /root/thunderbird-coverity fi
cd /root/thunderbird-coverity hg pull -u https://hg.mozilla.org/mozilla-central/
if test ! -d comm; then hg clone https://hg.mozilla.org/comm-central comm/ else cd comm hg pull https://hg.mozilla.org/comm-central hg update cd .. fi
export PATH=\$PATH:/opt/cov-analysis/bin/:/var/lib/jenkins/.cargo/bin cargo install cbindgen --force echo "Cleanup previous build" rm -rf obj-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu cov-build.tar.gz cov-int/ obj-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
echo "Cleanup previous report" rm -rf reports/
python client.py checkout
echo "Cleanup" ./mach clobber echo 'ac_add_options --enable-application=comm/mail' > .mozconfig echo 'ac_add_options --enable-debug' >> .mozconfig echo 'ac_add_options --enable-calendar' >> .mozconfig echo 'ac_add_options --disable-gtest-in-build' >> .mozconfig
cat .mozconfig
cov-configure --gcc cov-configure --comptype clangcc --compiler clang-8
#--xml-option=skip_file:"(\/tmp\/.*\.(cpp|cc|c))|(\/usr\/.*)|(mozilla\/.*)"
# Run the configure separatly to avoid issues detection here ./mach --log-no-times configure
echo "Rebuild all without coverity" ./mach --log-no-times build
echo "Touch all tb files to retrigger the build" touch \$(find comm/ -type f -iname '*.cpp' -o -iname '*.c')
echo "build only tb files using coverity" cov-build --dir cov-int ./mach --log-no-times build -v
# For some reasons, coverity adds garbage at the end. Removing it LINE=\$(grep -n "are ready for analysis" cov-int/build-log.txt |cut -d: -f1) if test -z "\$LINE"; then echo "are ready for analysis" exit 1 fi sed -i '\$LINE,\$d' cov-int/build-log.txt
#LINE=\$((LINE+1)) #sed -i '1Ã©,/pattern/!d' cov-int/build-log.txt #sed "\$LINE,\\\$d" < cov-int/build-log.txt > cov-int/build-log.txt.tmp #sed -i "/EXECUTING: /usr/bin/python.* /root/thunderbird-coverity/python/.*/d" cov-int/build-log.txt.tmp #sed -i -e :a -e '/^\n*$/{$d;N;};/\n$/ba' cov-int/build-log.txt.tmp #sed -i "/EXECUTING: sh /root/.*/build/moz.configure/../autoconf/config.guess/d" cov-int/build-log.txt.tmp
#mv cov-int/build-log.txt.tmp cov-int/build-log.txt tail cov-int/build-log.txt
tar zcvf cov-build.tar.gz cov-int/
minimumsize=100000 actualsize=\$(du -k cov-build.tar.gz | cut -f 1) if [ \$actualsize -ge \$minimumsize ]; then sh /opt/upload-to-coverity.sh else echo "Unexpected filesize. Should be at least \$minimumsize (found \$actualsize)" exit 1 fi
#cd .. #rm -rf obj-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu cov-build.tar.gz cov-int/ obj-x86_64-pc-linux-gnu
exit 0 GLOBALEOF
if ! test -e ~/buster/dev/null; then sudo mount --bind /dev ~/buster/dev fi if ! test -e ~/buster/proc/uptime; then sudo mount -t proc /proc ~/buster/root/proc fi
chmod +x buster/root/run-thunderbird.sh
sudo chroot ~/buster/ ./root/run-thunderbird.sh
